title: Coalition reunited after last-minute deal | ABC NEWS
description: The Liberal and National party leaders have announced a reunification deal.   The Coalition split after three National senators broke away from shadow cabinet and voted against the government's hate groups bill, and were then fired from the frontbench.   "The Coalition is the most enduring and successful partnership in Australia's political history, and we have a record of delivering strong and stable government," said Liberal leader Sussan Ley at a joint press conference with Nationals leader David Littleproud.  Under the new agreement, the Coalition will operate under a new framework preventing either party from overriding a decision of shadow cabinet.  The deal to bring the parties back together also includes allowing the fired senators to return to the front bench.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. description: A power vacuum in Bangladesh is set to be filled with the country's first free and fair elections in over a decade to take place. title: Terry the turtle released into Sydney Harbour after life-saving surgery | ABC NEWS
description: Terry the turtle has been released back into Sydney Harbour after a life-saving flipper amputation at the Taronga Zoo Wildlife Hospital. Terry's flipper had become tightly tangled in fishing wire. After five weeks of intensive care and recovery, Terry moved onto rehabilitation before being released. title: Illegal e-bikes to be seized and destroyed in NSW crackdown | ABC NEWS
description: New speed detection devices will be moved around New South Wales, allowing police to detect speeding illegal e-bikes as part of a major crackdown.   Devices found to be going over the state's e-bike speed limit of 25 kilometres per hour will be seized and destroyed by authorities, under expanded police powers.   Any e-bike that operates in throttle-only mode, where riders do not have to pedal to power the device, is illegal on the state's roads under current laws.   üñäÔ∏è Julia Andr√© üé§ Emily Laurence  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: SA Liberals promise new stamp duty concessions and officially launch election campaign | ABC NEWS
description: The South Australian Liberals have promised new stamp duty relief for home-owners looking to downsize if they win the March election.  Under the Liberal pre-election policy, South Australians over the age of 55 could be eligible for a one-off $15,000 concession on stamp duty to move into a smaller home under $1.2 million.  Party leader Ashton Hurn announced the policy, designed to "create movement" in the housing market, at the Liberal's official campaign launch at the Adelaide casino on Sunday. title: Why are you meeting everyone at 'a very Chinese time'? | ABC NEWS
description: Have you noticed a lot of people online are feeling "Chinese"?   Videos captioned "You met me at a very Chinese time in my life" have gone viral on Instagram and TikTok. It's being seen as major shift from how Chinese culture has been perceived in the past.
